Key Match Events: The Nuggets started strong, outscoring the Clippers 33-19 in the first quarter and never looked back.
Jamal Murray, Russell Westbrook, Michael Porter Jr. and Julian Strawther each contributed at least five points, helping Denver establish a commanding 33-19 lead by the end of the first quarter.
The Nuggets kept up their offensive barrage in the second half, outscoring the Clippers by seven. Denver’s lead reached as high as 29, and they never trailed during the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite missing Nikola Jokic on Wednesday night, the Denver Nuggets had no trouble overpowering the Kawhi Leonard-less LA Clippers at Ball Arena, cruising to a 126-103 victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets shot a strong 48.6% from 3-point range (17-of-35) and 55.1% overall, while holding a 29-14 advantage in assists.
The Clippers were led by Norman Powell’s 30 points but shot just 37.5% overall, including 28.9% from deep.
Six players from the Nuggets scored in double figures during the dominant performance.
Others: Nikola Jokic was sidelined due to illness, and Kawhi Leonard was absent to address personal matters related to the LA wildfires.
Jamal Murray took charge with 21 points and nine assists in Jokic’s absence.
Russell Westbrook contributed 19 points, eight assists and six rebounds.
